work.name: headstarter ai
work.summary: selective program to receive software engineering training from faang & senior-level developers. includes ds&a + interview prep, full-stack application projects, hackathons, and software design principles education

work.name: capstone investment advisors
work.summary: on the risk/quant dev desk, i developed a full-stack linux app using front-end (html/css/ts) and back-end (python) technologies, integrating a c++ optimization algorithm and a machine learning model for dimensionality reduction and clustering. i created data visualizations, debugged with git bash, and conducted mathematical analyses to ensure algorithms' convergence and scalability.

work.name: the ohio state university
work.summary: i shadowed dr. davanloo for the 2023-24 school year in an unpaid setting, where I was taught lp, ip, qp, optimization applications, optimization consulting, and took the graduate-level course ise 7200, advanced nonlinear optimization.

work.name: j.p. morgan
work.summary: as part of the advancing black pathways program, i interned at the investment bank in nyc under risk management/analytics and securities services. i was taught banking fundamentals and was introduced to quant finance by my manager. i worked through a few data analytics projects in python, excel, and tableau.

work.name: the ohio state university
work.summary: i was a research assistant to dr. liling ko, studying combinatorics in graph theory. i developed code in matlab and python in our attempt to find p(8)-free bipartite graphs, an np-complete problem. our work did not result in a paper, but i learned so much in the year i spent with this incredible teacher!

work.name: the ohio state university
work.summary: i was a summer research assistant to the kawakami group, designing GUIs in python to control devices over networks. i configured electronics & circuits,

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

courses: math courses: real analysis, advanced nonlinear optimization, linear optimization, linear algebra, differential equations, probability, mathematical statistics, discrete mathematics
cis courses: introduction to java, data structures in java, software components

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
